sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"摇动"之意。
means: rock ： 多指猛烈地摇动或摇晃。
sway ： 主要指树枝等的来回摇动。
swing ： 指有规律地前后、上下摆动，也可指不停地转动。

sentence.Network_en: A hard-core group of right-wing senators had hoped to sway their colleagues.
sentence.Network_cn: 一群骨干右翼参议员曾企图左右自己的同僚。

sentence.Network_en: South of the Usk, a completely different approach seems to hold sway.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿斯克以南盛行的似乎是一种完全不同的方式。

sentence.Network_en: In medieval times the church held sway over many countries.
sentence.Network_cn: 在中世纪,教会支配着许多国家.

jx.jx_en_mean: have great power or influence over a particular person, place, or domain
jx.jx_cn_mean: （对人，地方，领域）有支配力量；占统治地位

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: corresponding in sense to Low German swājen 'be blown to and fro' and Dutch zwaaien 'swing, walk totteringly'

encyclopedia.content: 基本信息 歌名：<Sway>歌手：Bic Runga 地区：新西兰 语言：英文 所属专辑：<Beautiful Collision> 发行时间：2002年11月05日 Sway 的原曲是墨西哥作曲家 Pablo Beltrán Ruiz 在 1953年写的曼波曲(Mambo Song)，原曲名 "Quien Sera"。 1954年 Norman Gimbel 谱上英语歌词、由 Dean Martin 主唱成为上榜歌曲。其后翻唱歌手不计其数，近年唱红的有 Michael Bublé(2003)、Pussycat Dolls(2004)。 创作背景

entry.def: When people or things sway, they lean or swing slowly from one side to the other.

example.ex: The people swayed back and forth with arms linked...
example.tran: 人们手挽手，前后摇晃着。

example.ex: The whole boat swayed and tipped.

entry.def: If you are swayed by someone or something, you are influenced by them.

example.ex: Don't ever be swayed by fashion.
example.tran: 永远不要受潮流的影响。

example.ex: ...last minute efforts by the main political parties to sway the voters in tomorrow's local elections.
example.tran: 主要政党为说服选民在明天的地方选举中投自己一票而作出的最后努力

entry.tran: 占统治地位;具有重大影响力
entry.def: If someone or something holds sway, they have great power or influence over a particular place or activity.

example.ex: South of the Usk, a completely different approach seems to hold sway...
example.tran: 阿斯克以南盛行的似乎是一种完全不同的方式。

example.ex: The 'families' are the basic units, each holding sway over a recognised territory.
example.tran: “家庭”是基本单位，每一个家庭都控制着自己受人认可的领地。

entry.tran: 在…的控制下;在…的支配下;在…的影响下
entry.def: If you are under the sway of someone or something, they have great influence over you.

example.ex: How mothers keep daughters under their sway is the subject of the next five sections.
example.tran: 在接下来的 5 节将探讨母亲怎样管教女儿。

means.word_mean: 1. move back and forth or sideways;

sentences.sentence: "She rocked back and forth on her feet"

means.word_mean: 2. move or walk in a swinging or swaying manner;

sentences.sentence: "His speech did not sway the voters"

means.word_mean: 4. cause to move back and forth;

auth_sentence.content: Blockbuster scholarship offers don't always sway top talents.
auth_sentence.res_content: Blockbuster scholarship offers don't always sway top talents.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Blockbuster scholarship offers don't always sway top talents.

auth_sentence.content: He did not have a magical ability to sway.
auth_sentence.res_content: He did not have a magical ability to sway.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He did not have a magical ability to sway.

auth_sentence.content: Even small changes in margins often sway investors.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even small changes in margins often sway investors.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even small changes in margins often sway investors.

Sentence.sentence: contributes to environmental protection Romantic love has clear evolutionary roots but our views about what makes an ideal romantic relationship can be swayed by the society we live in
Applicants and their parents are said to believe that the personal essay can sway the admissions committee.

sentences.en: The dancers swayed to the music.
sentences.cn: 跳舞的人随着音乐节奏摇摆。

sentences.en: He swayed his head from side to side with worry.
sentences.cn: 他忧心忡忡地频频摇头。

means.word_mean: 影响、改变…的观点[行动];说服；使相信；使动摇

sentences.en: His speech failed to sway his colleagues into supporting the plan.
sentences.cn: 他的一番话没能使他的同事支持这项计划。

sentences.en: He felt the sway of the deck under his feet.
sentences.cn: 他感觉到脚下甲板的摇动。

sentences.en: In medieval times the church held sway over many countries.
sentences.cn: 在中世纪, 教会支配着许多国家。

jushi.english: She swayed and fell in a faint.
The trees were swaying gently in the wind.
The sailboat swayed on the stormy sea.
jushi.chinese: 帆船在暴风雨的海面上摇晃。
